support_summary: The E3 SUMO-protein ligase PIAS1 (Protein Inhibitor of Activated STAT 1) mediates the SUMOylation of the active, nuclear form of ATF6. This post-translational modification occurs at a conserved lysine residue (Lys149) and represses its transcriptional activity, acting as a negative feedback mechanism to fine-tune the UPR.

functions.cellular_process: The E3 SUMO-protein ligase PIAS1 mediates the SUMOylation of the active, nuclear form of ATF6 at a conserved lysine residue (Lys149) within its trans-activation domain.
functions.effect_description: PIAS1-mediated SUMOylation represses the transcriptional activity of ATF6, thereby attenuating the expression of its downstream target genes as part of a negative feedback loop.
biological_consequence: PIAS1 E3 ligase binds to the active nuclear form of ATF6 → PIAS1 mediates the attachment of a SUMO-1 moiety to Lys149 of ATF6 → SUMOylation represses the transcriptional activity of ATF6 → Expression of UPR target genes is attenuated
specific_effects: Adds a SUMO-1 moiety to ATF6 at residue Lys149.
Reduces the ability of ATF6 to activate target gene promoters.
Overexpression of PIAS1 increases ATF6 SUMOylation.

evidence.paper_title: SUMOylation Represses the Transcriptional Activity of the Unfolded Protein Response Transducer ATF6
evidence.authors: Xia Hou, Zhao Yang, Kunning Li, Yifei Li, Yixuan Wang, Shiyun Wang, Ling-Yu Wang, Ling Chen
evidence.relevant_quote: The human ATF6 protein can be SUMOylated mediated through the small ubiquitin-like modifier protein 1 (SUMO-1) and E3 SUMO-protein ligase 1 (PIAS1) at the conserved sumoylation residue Lys149...

mechanism: The E3 SUMO-protein ligase PIAS1 mediates the SUMOylation of the active, nuclear form of ATF6 at a conserved lysine residue (Lys149) within its trans-activation domain.
effect: PIAS1-mediated SUMOylation represses the transcriptional activity of ATF6, thereby attenuating the expression of its downstream target genes as part of a negative feedback loop.
summary: ATF6 inhibits PIAS1 to modulate repression of atf6 transcriptional activity, ultimately affecting expression of upr target genes is attenuated.
